title: Color-Coded Office Escape
intro: You are in a small office filled with everyday objects. Three colored doors block your way out. Somewhere in this room are the clues you need to escape.

objects.name: wall painting
objects.inspect_text: Behind the painting, someone scribbled: "The first half of the safe code is 12."

objects.name: ceramic vase
objects.inspect_text: Inside the vase, you find a folded note: "The second half of the safe code is 34."

objects.name: metal safe
objects.inspect_text: A sturdy metal safe with a four-digit keypad. It probably holds something important.

lock.on_success_text: The safe beeps and unlocks. Inside is a card that reads: "What color is created when mixing yellow and blue? That is the door to escape from."
lock.on_failure_text: The safe emits a dull buzz. The code is incorrect.

objects.name: green door
objects.inspect_text: A solid green door with a four-digit keypad. It feels like the most promising way out.

lock.on_success_text: The keypad flashes green and the green door swings open. Fresh air rushes in — you have escaped!
lock.on_failure_text: The keypad flashes red. The green door stays firmly locked.

objects.name: red door
objects.inspect_text: A heavy red door with a keypad. There are no obvious hints nearby.

lock.on_success_text: Against all odds, the red door unlocks. (But this code is never hinted in the room.)
lock.on_failure_text: The red door stays locked. Nothing happens.

objects.name: blue door
objects.inspect_text: A blue door with a scuffed keypad. You don't see anything pointing to a code for it.

lock.on_success_text: Somehow, the blue door unlocks. (This code is not logically derivable from the room clues.)
lock.on_failure_text: The blue door remains locked with a dull beep.

objects.name: office desk
objects.inspect_text: In the desk drawer, you find a sticky note: "The escape door code is the safe code written backwards."

objects.name: wall calendar
objects.inspect_text: The calendar is open to April. Several dates are circled: 3, 7, 19, 28 — but nothing ties them to any keypad.

objects.name: wall clock
objects.inspect_text: The clock reads 7:21. A small sticker on the back says, "Time doesn’t help with the codes."

objects.name: bookshelf
objects.inspect_text: Most books are dusty manuals. One spine reads: "Color Theory 101" but flipping through yields only trivia like "red and blue make purple." Nothing about door codes.

objects.name: patterned rug
objects.inspect_text: The rug has a repeating pattern of shapes: 4 circles, 3 triangles, 2 squares. It looks decorative rather than meaningful.

objects.name: potted plant
objects.inspect_text: Under the pot you find a tiny tag: "Don't overthink: some clues mix, some don't." It seems to nudge you toward simple color mixing.

objects.name: desk lamp
objects.inspect_text: A small desk lamp with a yellow bulb. A faint note on the base reads: "Light can change color when mixed, just like paint."

objects.name: whiteboard
objects.inspect_text: On the whiteboard someone has written: "Start with the safe. Everything else falls into place."
